page.title: 01GENERAL DESCRIPTION,LYDART
page.content: Our 'block' is a rural landscape with the edge of the village of Penallt to the east,and part of Mitchel Troy to the west. We are three miles from Monmouth and the Wye Valley,and have wonderful views of the Brecon Beacons and Black Mountains to the west. The central part of this area is called Lydart,so we shall refer to the whole 'block' by this name. We have a mixture of small farms and Forestry Commission woods,modern housing,traditional Welsh longhouses and abandoned,derelict farm labourers cottages. Lydart is typical of rural Britain;we have a 'Pick Your Own' fruit farm;some families do 'Bed & Breakfast for tourists;we have a W.I. and cricket club;convent and pub;local children go to school in Penallt or Mitchel Troy while their mothers shop in Monmouth.
